snippet: The United States made good on a threat made last week, with the State Department calling it “not a decision that was taken lightly.”...
abstract: United States suspends talks with Russia over Syria, accusing Russians of aiding Syrian Air Force in carrying out sustained bombing campaign against city of Aleppo; Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin withdraws from landmark arms control agreement that called for both sides to dispose of 34 tons of plutonium in response.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and ANDREW E. KRAMER
byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon reported from Washington and Andrew E. Kramer from Moscow. Somini Sengupta contributed from the United Nations.

lead_paragraph: The United States made good on a threat made last week, with the State Department calling it “not a decision that was taken lightly.”

headline.main: Tension With Russia Rises as U.S. Halts Syria Negotiations
headline.print_headline: Syria Talks End, Newly Bruising U.S.-Russia Ties

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Arms Control and Limitation and Disarmament
